intro: Dischidia kawengica, commonly known as the Kawengica ivy, is a climbing vine native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its aerial roots that allow it to cling to surfaces. The plant has heart-shaped, opposite leaves that are usually covered in a fine, fuzzy texture. It produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by orange or red berries. Dischidia kawengica is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care.
